newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila shares ebb lower at close, off day's low.
newsitem.headline: Manila shares ebb lower at close, off day's low.

text.p: * Blue chips mixed as foreign investors stay out
Manila shares recovered part of the sharp losses from early trade but ended lower than the previous day's level as the market remained tentative, brokers said.
The composite index closed at 2,682.10, which is 12.30 points or 0.46 percent lower than Wednesday's close. The index fell to a low of 2,654.20 in early trade.
"We recovered somewhat after an initial selldown on the blue chips," Allan Araullo of Regina Capital Development Corp said.
Jose Maria Ricardo Garcia, vice president of Diversified Securities, said the market remained cautious even if selling pressure from foreign houses had abated by midsession.
"People are very tentative ... There was just some buying support in select shares from the locals," Garcia said.
Oil refiner Petron Corp closed 20 centavos higher at 8.50 pesos and phone giant Philippine Long Distance Telephone gained 10 pesos to 755 pesos.
Ayala Corp B dipped 25 centavos to 17 pesos.
The mixed performance of the blue chips indicates a consolidation mood in the market, Araullo said.
"Investors are looking for reasons to come back to the market," he added.
